gurmukhi: ਰੋਸ ਭਰਯੋ ਸਭ ਅੰਗ ਜਰਯੋ ਮੁਖ ਰੱਤ ਕਰਯੋ ਜੁਗ ਨੈਨ ਤਚਾੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Ros Bdaryo Sabh An Daryo Moukh Ratt Daryo Joug Nain Tachaae||
translation: Hearing these words, Ravan was filled with anger and his limbs began to burn, his face turned red and his eyes expanded with anger.

gurmukhi: ਤੈ ਨ ਲਗੈ ਹਮਰੇ ਸਠ ਬੋਲਨ ਮਾਨਸ ਦੁਅੈ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਗਨਾੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Tai Na Lagad Hamre Sath Bolan Maanas Duai Avtaar Gadaae||
translation: He said, “O fool ! what are you speaking before me and considering those two men as incarnations;

gurmukhi: ਮਾਤ ਕੀ ੲੇਕਹੀ ਬਾਤ ਕਹੇ ਤਜ ਤਾਤ ਘ੍ਰਿਣਾ ਬਨਬਾਸ ਨਿਕਾਰੇ ॥
transliteration: Maat Kiek-hibaat Kahe Taj Taat Ghrinaa Banaas Nikdare||
translation: “Their mother spoke only once and their father indignantly sent them to the forest;

gurmukhi: ਤੇ ਦੋੳੂ ਦੀਨ ਅਧੀਨ ਜੁਗੀਯਾ ਕਸ ਕੈ ਭਿਰਹੈਂ ਸੰਗ ਅਾਨ ਹਮਾਰੇ ॥੩੫੦॥
transliteration: Te Dooo Deen Adheen Jougeeyaa Kas Kai Bhir-hain San Aan Hamdare||350||
translation: “Both of them are lowly and helpless, how will they be able to fight against me.350.

gurmukhi: ਜੳੁ ਨਹੀ ਜਾਤ ਤਹਾਂ ਕਹ ਤੈ ਸਠਿ ਤੋਰ ਜਟਾਨ ਕੋ ਜੂਟ ਪਟੈ ਹੌ ॥
transliteration: Jau Nahijaat Tahaan Kah Tai Sath(i) Tor Jataan Ko Jeet Padai Hau||
translation: “O fool ! if I had not come to ask you for going there, I would have uprooted and thrown your matted hair,

gurmukhi: ਕੰਚਨ ਕੋਟ ਕੇ ੳੂਪਰ ਤੇ ਡਰ ਤੋਹਿ ਨਦੀਸਰ ਬੀਚ ਡੁਬੈ ਹੌ ॥
transliteration: Kanchanndkot Ke Oopar Te Dar Toh(i) Nadeesar Beech Doubai Hau||
translation: “And from the top of this golden citadel I would have thrown you in the sea and get you drowned.”

gurmukhi: ਚਿੱਤ ਚਿਰਾਤ ਬਸਾਤ ਕਛੂ ਨ ਰਿਸਾਤ ਚਲਯੋ ਮੁਨ ਘਾਤ ਪਛਾਨੀ ॥
transliteration: Chitt Chiraat Basaat Kachhodh Na Risaat Chadyo Mounndghaat Pachhaadee||
translation: Hearing these world and pining in his mind and in anger, realizing the gravity of the occasion, Marich left that place;

gurmukhi: ਰਾਵਨ ਨੀਚ ਕੀ ਮੀਚ ਅਧੋਗਤ ਰਾਘਵ ਪਾਨ ਪੁਰੀ ਸੁਰਿ ਮਾਨੀ ॥੩੫੧॥
transliteration: Raavan Neech Kimeech Adhogad Raaghav Paan Purisur(i) Maanee||351||
translation: He felt that the death and decadence of the vile Ravan is certain at the hands of Ram.351.

gurmukhi: ਕੰਚਨ ਕੋ ਹਰਨਾ ਬਨ ਕੇ ਰਘੁਬੀਰ ਬਲੀ ਜਹ ਥੋ ਤਹ ਅਾਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Kanchanndko Harnaa Ban Ke Raghoubeer Balijah Tho Tah Aayo||
translation: He transformed himself into a golden deer and reached at the abode of Ram.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਵਨ ਹ੍ਵੈ ੳੁਤ ਕੇ ਜੁਗੀਅਾ ਸੀਅ ਲੈਨ ਚਲਯੋ ਜਨੁ ਮੀਚ ਚਲਾਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Raavan Hvai Out Ke Jougeeaa Sia Lain Chadyo Jan(u) Meech Chalaayo||
translation: On the other side Ravana put on the garb of a Yogi and went to abduct Sita, it seemed that death was driving him there.

gurmukhi: ਸੀਅ ਬਿਲੋਕ ਕੁਰੰਕ ਪ੍ਰਭਾ ਕਹ ਮੋਹਿ ਰਹੀ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਤੀਰ ੳੁਚਾਰੀ ॥
transliteration: Seea Bilok Kurank Prabhaa Kah Moh(i) Rahiprabh Teer Ouchdaree||
translation: Seeing the beauty of the golden deer, Sita came near Ram and said :

gurmukhi: ਅਾਨ ਦਿਜੈ ਹਮ ਕੱੳੁ ਮ੍ਰਿਗ ਵਾਸੁਨ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਅਵਧੇਸ ਮੁਕੰਦ ਮੁਰਾਰੀ ॥੩੫੨॥
transliteration: Aan Dijai Ham Kau Mrig Vaasoun Sriavdhes Moukand Murdaree||352||
translation: “O the king of Oudh and the destroyer of demons ! Go and bring that deer for me.”352.

gurmukhi: ਸੀਅ ਮ੍ਰਿਗਾ ਕਹੂੰ ਕੰਚਨ ਕੋ ਨਹਿ ਕਾਨ ਸੁਨਯੋ ਬਿਧਿਨੈ ਨ ਬਨਾਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Seea Mrigad Kahoon Kanchanndko Nah(i) Kaan Sounyo Bidhinai Na Banaayo||
translation: “O Sita ! no one had heard about the golden deer and even the Lord hath not created it;
